content:
Diagnosis:		Metastatic squamous cell carcinoma of oral cavity

Management:		Palliative pembrolizumab/chemotherapy combination

Histology:		Moderately differentiated squamous cell carcinoma, PDL1 CPS 40%

Current Situation:	Cycle 4 review

[redacted name] attended for review today prior to cycle 4 of palliative pembrolizumab/carboplatin/5-FU combination therapy. His disease was initially diagnosed in January 2024 following investigation of progressive right-sided jaw pain, with biopsy confirming squamous cell carcinoma. Initial staging demonstrated a T4aN2b primary tumor with bone metastases affecting C5 vertebra and left iliac crest. He commenced systemic therapy in February 2024 following MDT discussion.

He has experienced a good clinical response to treatment thus far, with significant improvement in his jaw pain and reduction in analgesic requirements. His most recent CT assessment on 15 April 2024 demonstrated partial response in both primary disease and nodal disease, with stable appearance of bone metastases. His performance status remains 1, though he describes grade 2 fatigue requiring afternoon rest periods. He has developed grade 1 mucositis which is managed with regular mouthwash. Recent thyroid function tests showed early signs of immune-related thyroiditis with suppressed TSH, though he remains clinically euthyroid.

Today's blood tests show stable renal function and adequate haematological parameters for cycle 4. The plan is to continue with treatment at full doses. I have prescribed prophylactic fluconazole for his mucositis. We will arrange interval imaging after cycle 6 and review again in three weeks with thyroid function monitoring.

primary_cancer.metastases: bone metastases affecting C5 vertebra and left iliac crest

cancer_timeline.value: Initial presentation with progressive right-sided jaw pain
CT shows partial response in primary and nodal disease, stable bone metastases

patient_facts.value: Grade 2 fatigue requiring afternoon rest periods
Early signs of immune-related thyroiditis with suppressed TSH, clinically euthyroid

status_updates.value: Metastatic oral cavity SCC showing good partial response to immunotherapy/chemotherapy combination with manageable toxicities
Partial response in primary and nodal disease, stable bone metastases, improved jaw pain
Grade 2 fatigue, grade 1 mucositis, early thyroiditis
Continuing with cycle 4 at full doses, added prophylactic fluconazole
Interval imaging after cycle 6, thyroid function monitoring
